content:
User: C:\AI-Execution-System>curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"task_description": "Research the key technological advancements in AI in the last 5 years and summarize their potential impact on society."}' https://us-central1-ai-execution-system.cloudfunctions.net/ai-system-backend curl: (3) unmatched close brace/bracket in URL position 119: Research the key technological advancements in AI in the last 5 years and summarize their potential impact on society.}'                                                                                                                       ^ C:\AI-Execution-System>

Gemini: curl is misinterpreting part of your TASK DESCRIPTION as being part of the URL itself, specifically around position 119, because of the spaces and characters in the description.

LET'S FIX THE curl COMMAND SYNTAX!

We need to properly "quote" or "escape" the TASK DESCRIPTION string so that curl treats it as a single data argument and not as part of the URL or command syntax.

TRY THIS UPDATED curl COMMAND EXACTLY:

curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{\"task_description\": \"Research the key technological advancements in AI in the last 5 years and summarize their potential impact on society.\"}" https://us-central1-ai-execution-system.cloudfunctions.net/ai-system-backend
MAJOR CHANGE in this corrected curl command:

DOUBLE QUOTES " AROUND THE -d DATA VALUE: Instead of single quotes '...', we are now using double quotes "..." to enclose the JSON data for the -d option.
ESCAPED DOUBLE QUOTES \" INSIDE JSON: Because we are using double quotes to enclose the entire -d data value, we now need to ESCAPE the double quotes inside the JSON data (around task_description and the task description string itself) using backslashes \. So, "task_description" becomes \"task_description\" and "Research..." becomes \"Research...".
This updated syntax with double quotes and escaped inner quotes is generally more robust for passing JSON data in curl commands, especially when dealing with strings that contain spaces and special characters in command-line shells.

PLEASE COPY and PASTE this UPDATED curl command EXACTLY into your terminal and PRESS ENTER again.

THIS UPDATED COMMAND SHOULD FIX THE SYNTAX ERROR and correctly send the HTTP POST request to your Cloud Function with the TASK DESCRIPTION as JSON data.

AFTER RUNNING THIS UPDATED curl COMMAND, PLEASE REPORT BACK:

"UPDATED CURL COMMAND EXECUTED in terminal..." (When you paste the updated command and press Enter).
TERMINAL OUTPUT (COPY and PASTE the entire output from your terminal after running the updated curl command).
EXPECTED JSON RESPONSE? YES or NO - Did you get the JSON response that looks like {"echoed_task_description": ..., "status": "task_echoed"} ?
If YES: "ECHO TASK TEST SUCCESSFUL with UPDATED CURL! TERMINAL SHOWS EXPECTED JSON RESPONSE!"
If NO: "ECHO TASK TEST FAILED AGAIN - TERMINAL SHOWS: [Describe what you see in the terminal output - error message, different JSON, etc.]"
LET'S TRY THIS CORRECTED curl COMMAND SYNTAX! GO! GO! GO! FOCUS! EXECUTE! NEXT!

Logo for Gemini Apps
Gemini Apps
